alert.note: Alert for Guam; Rota; Saipan; Tinian (Guam) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued January 02 at 4:03PM ChST until January 04 at 6:00AM ChST by NWS Guam
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM CHST TUESDAY ALONG NORTH FACING REEFS... ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK UNTIL 6 AM CHST TUESDAY ALONG NORTH AND EAST FACING REEFS... * WHAT...Large breaking waves of 7 to 9 feet along north facing reefs to 8 feet expected in the surf zone. For the High Rip Current Risk, dangerous rip currents expected. * WHERE...High Surf along north facing reefs of the Marianas. High rip risk along north and east facing reefs. * WHEN...For the High Surf Advisory and the High Rip Current Risk, until 6 AM ChST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Dangerous swimming and surfing conditions and localized beach erosion. Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...These hazards may continue into Tuesday and Wednesday.
info.instruction: Inexperienced swimmers should remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions. Swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, relax and float. Don`t swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline.
